newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Commission studies Scottish salmon dumping complaint.
newsitem.headline: Commission studies Scottish salmon dumping complaint.

text.p: The European Commission was considering a Scottish request on Friday to impose minimum prices on imports of farmed salmon, Scottish officials said.
Scottish Secretary Michael Forsyth made the request after farmed salmon prices fell to their lowest level since minimum import prices were lifted in June.

"The depressed state of the market for farmed salmon is such that I am writing to (Fisheries) Commissioner Bonino to request the immediate reintroduction of minimum import prices," Forsyth said in a statement.
The Scottish Salmon Growers' Association filed a complaint with the Commission in June that Norwegian salmon was being dumped onto the EU market at less than cost price.
But the Commission is unlikely to complete its inquiry until May 1997.
Following complaints from Scottish and Irish salmon farmers late last year, the Commission introduced minimum import prices but producers said this move did little to restore the market.
